From: "Billy or Nancy" <FUNLists@...>
Subject: RE: Unschooling Handbook

BlankHas anyone else on this list read it? Actually, someone on this list
wrote it! At least Mary has dropped in on the list from time to time.

You might also want to take a look at Mary's "The Homeschooling Handbook"
and "The Homeschooling Book of Answers" by Linda Dobson. You can find
descriptions of these and other homeschooling books at:
http://www.fun-books.com/homeschooling.htm

Billy
Family Unschoolers Network
http://www.unschooling.org
FUN Books
http://www.FUN-Books.com
Featuring the new John Taylor Gatto book!

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Handbook
messages.msgSnippet: Blank I just had to share this.  My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent me a book titled, The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffith.  It is a
messages.messageBody:
Blank

I just had to share this.  My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent me a book titled, 'The Unschooling Handbook' by Mary Griffith.  It is a wonderful book!  I couldn't put it down!  I have already read half of the book today!  I recommend it to anyone who is unschooling, thinking about unschooling, unschools but has doubts about their kids not learning anything, READ IT!!!!  I wish that I would have found this book a long time ago!
Has anyone else on this list read it?
Kim 
 
Ha, ha, ha, hahahahahaha......sorry. On other lists I am known as The Book Faerie (ret), after my husband found this book and The Homeschooling Handbook for only $1 each at a local book store. I mailed out over 75 of them, all over the country, and a couple overseas. So, yes...I've read it! I esp like the list of resources. 
 
If anyone here is near the Auburn WA SuperMall, it was at Foozles. I don't know if there's any left, but there's so many great books there for just $2 or less.
 
----Valerie

Has anyone else on this list read it? Actually, someone on this list wrote it! At least Mary has dropped in on the list from time to time.
 
You might also want to take a look at Mary's "The Homeschooling Handbook"  and "The Homeschooling Book of Answers" by Linda Dobson. You can find descriptions of these and other homeschooling books at:  http://www.fun-books.com/homeschooling.htm
 
Billy

-----Original Message-----

Hi All,
I just had to share this.  My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent me a book titled, 'The Unschooling Handbook' by Mary Griffith.  It is a wonderful book!  I couldn't put it down!  I have already read half of the book today!  I recommend it to anyone who is unschooling, thinking about unschooling, unschools but has doubts about their kids not learning anything, READ IT!!!!  I wish that I would have found this book a long time ago!
Has anyone else on this list read it?
Kim

Hi All,
I just had to share this.  My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent me a book titled, 'The Unschooling Handbook' by Mary Griffith.  It is a wonderful book!  I couldn't put it down!  I have already read half of the book today!  I recommend it to anyone who is unschooling, thinking about unschooling, unschools but has doubts about their kids not learning anything, READ IT!!!!  I wish that I would have found this book a long time ago!
Has anyone else on this list read it?
Kim
